page.title: 11QUARNDON:LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: QUARNDON WAS MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY SURVEY AS "CORNUM". QUARN COMES FROM QUERN MEANING MILLSTONE. {PLACES OF INTEREST: 1{CHALYBEATE WELL}IN WHICH USED TO FLOW MINERAL BEARING WATER.DANIEL DEFOE VISITED HERE BEFORE THE WELL DRIED UP FOLLOWING AN EARTH TREMOR. 2{NORMAN CHURCH 3{PINFOLD COTTAGE.}THE PINDER'S DUTY WAS TO KEEP THE PINFOLD IN ORDER AND TO ROUND UP STRAY CATTLE. THE OVERSEER OF THE VILLAGE WAS PAID ONE SHILLING FOR SWEARING THE PINDER IN. 4{THE SCHOOL}WAS FOUNDED BY LORD SCARSDALE OF KEDLESTON HALL AND TAKES ITS NAME CURZON FROM THE LORD'S FAMILY NAME. THIS FAMILY IS OF THE SAME LINEAGE AS THE FAMILY TO WHOM WILLIAM THE CONQUEROR GAVE THE ORIGINAL KEDLESTON ESTATE.
